metadata.title: CVE-2018-20685 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In OpenSSH 7.9, scp.c in the scp client allows remote SSH servers to bypassintended access restrictions via the filename of . or an empty filename.The impact is modifying the permissions of the target directory on theclient side.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20685` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.12
openssh-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.12
openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.12
ssh - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.12
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.12
ssh-krb5 - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.12').
